project.teaser: The iodine status is a primary determinant of thyroid disorders, which are a major cause of morbidity, particularly in women. In addition, even mild-to-moderate iodine deficiency during pregnancy is related to neurocognitive impairment in the offspring. Iodine deficiency...
project.objective: The iodine status is a primary determinant of thyroid disorders, which are a major cause of morbidity, particularly in women. In addition, even mild-to-moderate iodine deficiency during pregnancy is related to neurocognitive impairment in the offspring. Iodine deficiency imposes tremendous costs on the health-care systems of affected regions, but can easily be prevented by iodine fortification programmes. In many countries, iodine deficiency receives surprisingly little publicity. The initial EUthyroid consortium evaluated European prevention programmes against iodine deficiency and uncovered major limitations including the low awareness on the importance of iodine for healthy living. EUthyroid2 will now fill important gaps in the prevention of iodine deficiency in Europe and beyond. The main objective of EUthyroid2 is to improve the low awareness with respect to iodine deficiency-related risks in adolescents and young women. The major aim is to find best practice models for accessing and informing them to increase their awareness and to improve their iodine status in order to lay the foundation for their own thyroid and general health and that of their offspring. Implementation studies and community-based randomised-controlled trials will be conducted with the objective of increasing iodine-related awareness in adolescents and young women up to age of 24 before pregnancy. The interventions are multimodal and performed in the two settings educational system and ambulatory care in eight study regions. As public health project EUthyroid2 is not only science, but will also serve our societies. Therefore, dissemination of findings to various sectors of our countries and the EU will be of utmost importance. By finding best practice models to raise the awareness on the importance of iodine for a healthy life of their own and their offspring in young people, EUthyroid2 will lay the foundation for a cost-effective way to eradicate iodine deficiency-related disorders.
project.title: The next step towards the elimination of iodine deficiency and preventable iodine-related disorders in Europe
project.keywords: Iodine deficiency pregnancy offspring neurocognition prevention intervention

result.title: Updated data management plan
result.description: A detailed data management plan (DMP) will be developed for making EUthyroid2 data and research outputs findable, accessible, interoperable and reusable (FAIR).

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - EUthyroid2 (The next step towards the elimination of iodine deficiency and preventable iodine-related disorders in Europe)
result.teaser: Iodine deficiency is the world’s leading cause of thyroid disorders and the single most important and preventable cause of brain damage. For women getting pregnant, even mild-to-moderate ID during pregnancy is related to neurocognitive impairment in the offspring. Therefore...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Protocols and forms finalised
result.description: The interventions have to be conscientiously prepares to warrant best possible success of the studies. The preparatory phase will comprise pretests with quantitative interviews, the finalisation of standard operating procedures, the preparation and submission of informed/parental consent forms, information sheets and other documents needed for the ethic commissions and data protection officers. In tight collaboration with WP1 and WP4, educational material will be designed and then be translated into the languages of the respective countries. Finally, ambulatory care practices and schools will be sampled and randomly allocated to the intervention and the control groups. Practice staff and teachers in the intervention group will be educated with respect to the importance of a sufficient iodine status.

result.title: Study initiation package- ambulatory care
result.description: The study of setting 1 is ready to be rolled out. The pretests have been done and necessary adjustments have been made.

result.title: Educational material
result.description: The first tasks related to WP1 are to assess health-related awareness in the two target groups within the regions, to develop a logic model for each intervention, to develop a communication strategy and organisational project management for the implementation in regions as well as to develop a data analysis plan together with WP3. In sequence, conceptual prototypes of intervention material have to be developed, with WP2 giving input of country-specific characteristics that have to be considered when accessing schools and ambulatory care institutions. In tight collaboration with WP2 and WP4 first prototype regionally adapted materials will be produced, for use in interventions. These materials will include storybooks as train-the-trainer format for nurses and assistants, main messages for professionals and age-differentiated versions for participants, information with visualisation/infographic approach, country-specific iodine cookbooks and short videos.

result.title: EUthyroid2 website
result.description: Specific branding and brand guidelines will be developed for EUthyroid2, based on the design of the initial EUthyroid consortium to retain a strong connection to the previous work. EUthyroid2-branded information products will ensure stakeholder recognition, and templates will allow partners to add their own logo or additional details to these materials (e.g. video, podcasts, powerpoint presentation templates, leaflets, factsheets, posters, final result reports, etc.) and will be available on the website.

result.title: Grant announcement PR
result.description: The EUthyroid2 grant will be announced to media and stakeholders.

result.title: Study initiation package- educational systems
result.description: The study of setting 2 is ready to be rolled out. The pretests have been done and necessary adjustments have been made.

result.title: Communication plan
result.description: An initial communications plan will be developed at project outset, incorporating the two activities outlined in the background information. The communications and dissemination plan will set out all relevant elements of an optimised dissemination strategy including target audiences and key messages for each. Global, national and local dissemination tools, mechanisms and platforms will be developed. The initial plan will outline risk factors and countermeasures regarding the strategic aims of the dissemination. It will be reviewed and revised as the project progresses through an oversight mechanism that updates on research progress and reviews and revises messages and actions accordingly. Workplan streams will be developed and reviewed every six months.

result.title: Interview questions ready for use
result.description: Recommendations will be provided regarding questionnaires on the socioeconomic status, education, myths, nutrition, and IDD-related awareness of participants of the intervention studies. Instruments will be extracted from the previous studies to warrant comparability. All recommendations will be provided to the regional studies, and all recommendations will be made available on the EUthyroid2 websites for use in other and future research.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
